intro: Crepis fraasii, commonly known as the Fraas' mouse-ear, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow flowers. It is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats, thriving in cooler, moist environments. Crepis fraasii is a perennial species that blooms from late spring to early summer.
